page.title: 18Coal Lorries to Thorpe Marsh
page.content: During the miners strike,big coal lorries transported coal to{Thorpe {Marsh Power Station,}because railway workers were in support of the miners. Now lorries are used as well as trains to deliver coal to the station.The villagers of{Barnby Dun}are annoyed at the lorries damaging the roads of the village.Many of the lorries pass also through{Arksey}and{Bentley}damaging the roads there.{South Yorkshire {County Council}want to build a depot next to the canal so the roads would be less busy,but the villagers of{ {Barnby Dun}oppose the idea.During a half-hour period thirteen coal lorries went past us to{Thorpe Marsh.}After eleven o'clock in a thirty-five minute period we saw twenty-seven lorries of different kinds.Bumps and pot-holes occur in the roads after some lorries have gone over them five or six times.
